Incident.Summary: I responded to a unattended single vehicle crash. I located a handgun in plain view. Vehicle was towed to the barrack.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
Incident captured on BWC.
Neighborhood check:
Harrington DE Police Department 26012 Gary Road which was found to be a vacant residence.

Scene Processing:
One Ruger .357 Revolver hand gun was located in plain view on the rear passenger floor board.
MSP form 50 completed in accordance with MSP policy.
Form 67 Chain of custody completed for the unattended vehicle.
Form 67 Chain of custody for the Ruger .357.

Narrative:
     On June 27, 2023 at approximately 2203 hours I Tpr Buglio was dispatched to a single vehicle crash in the area of Burrsville Road and Baker Road, Denton MD. I was advised by dispatch that the vehicle was unattended.

     Upon arrival I observed the vehicle in a ditch running along Burrsville Road. I observed the vehicle, a white Dodge Charger Louisiana registration 799FKJ, to be disabled as a result of the crash. Maryland State Police Dispatch advised that there were several attempts to call the registered owner of the vehicle, identified as Caleb Nathaniel Fletcher (W/M DOB 11/01/2000). Delaware State Police were contacted and attempted to make contact Fletcher’s brother, but advised the residence is vacant. Maryland State Police contacted the surrounding hospitals to see if Fletcher checked in as a patient. Dispatch advised the Fletcher had not checked into any local hospital. A K-9 track was conducted of the following wood line near the vehicle which lead back to Burrsville Road. While inspecting the vehicle I observed a Ruger New Vaquer .357 Revolver (Serial Number 510-71290) in plain view. The Ruger was located on the rear passenger floor board. I secured the weapon and observed it was loaded at the time. I removed five life rounds from the Ruger. I secured the Ruger and ammunition in my vehicle. I observed numerous live rounds of .357 ammunition scattered throughout the vehicle. 404 Auto and Repair Towing responded to the scene and towed the vehicle to the MSP Easton Barrack pending a search warrant.

     I responded to the Easton Barrack and placed the Ruger .357 into Temporary Storage with the Form 67 and Property Held form. A form 67 was completed for the vehicle. The Maryland Gun Center was contacted in reference to this investigation and advised the Ruger was not stolen, or registered in Maryland. The Gun Center advised they would be providing further information in the future. An impound report was completed. ACRS report competed.

     I request this case be left open pending further investigation.

All events occurred in Caroline County Maryland.

IncidentVehicle.VehDamageDesc: Vehicle was involved in a roll over crash.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
NARRATIVE: 
    On 7/5/2023, investigators of the Firearms Enforcement Unit (FEU) were contacted by the Detective Sergeant of the Easton Barrack “I” to perform a test fire on a seized handgun. Investigators conducted a test fire on a Make: Ruger Model: New Vaquero Caliber: 357 magnum Serial Number: 510-71290. The test fire was conducted utilizing the Forensic Buddy which is a Portable Bullet Recovery System for Ballistic Comparison. Investigators fired two rounds of .38 special caliber ammunition used for the purpose of the ballistic comparison and the functionality of the firearm. The firearm was found to be functional and in working order. The shell casings and projectiles were collected, packaged, and processed per Maryland State Police policy. Both shell casings and projectiles were sent to the Maryland State Police Forensic Division to be entered into the National Integrated Ballistic Information Network (NIBIN). 

All events occurred in Talbot and Caroline County, Maryland.

Case Closed.

On June 27, 2023 at approximately 2203 hours, troopers assigned to the Maryland State Police - Easton Barrack were dispatched to the area of Burrsville Road and Baker Road, Denton, Caroline County, Maryland 21629 for a motor vehicle collision involving a single vehicle. Upon their arrival, the vehicle was located in a ditch and appeared to have sustained extensive damage. The vehicle was identified as a 2010 Dodge Charger (LA Registration: 799FKJ) registered to Caleb Nathaniel Fletcher ("Fletcher", W/M, DOB: 11/01/2000). The vehicle was unattended and the operator was unable to be located on or within the general vicinity of the scene. A K-9 unit responded to the scene and attempted to track the operator without success. 

        Troopers observed in plain view a Ruger New Vaquero (S/N: 510-71290) on the rear passenger-side floorboard. The firearm was secured and stored at the Maryland State Police - Easton Barrack property room and the vehicle was stored pending a search. The information was provided to the Maryland Gun Center who advised that Fletcher was prohibited from possessing firearms or ammunition in Maryland. 

        On June 28, 2023, investigators assigned to the Criminal Enforcement Division - Eastern Region (CEDER) were requested to assist with various investigative tasks. Investigators attempted to contact Fletcher via telephone without success. Investigators successfully reached his mother via telephone who advised that the vehicle was owned and solely operated by Fletcher and she had not spoken to him since prior to the incident. Fletcher's mother confirmed his cellular telephone number. Due to signs of potential injury and the fact that investigators could not establish Fletcher's well-being, an Emergency Situation Disclosure form was submitted to Verizon and investigators obtained last known coordinates and historical call records which indicated he was in Harrington, Delaware. While troopers were in route to the area of the ping, contact was made with Fletcher via telephone and he agreed to respond to the Maryland State Police - Easton Barrack to participate in a recorded interview. 

        Fletcher was read his Advice of Miranda Rights and he advised that the accident was caused after swerving to avoid a deer in the roadway. Fletcher stated that he contacted his brother who transported him from the scene to his residence. Fletcher advised that he purchased the firearm in New Orleans from "Greg Fetterman", and advised that he would attempt to locate notarized documents relevant to the purchase. At the time of the accident, Fletcher was the only individual in the vehicle. An MSP Form 78 was read to Fletcher and he provided written consent to search the vehicle. 

        A search of the vehicle was conducted and concluded with the seizure of ,357 Magnum bullets that were spread throughout the vehicle (count: 23). The ammunition was stored at the Maryland State Police - Easton Barrack pending the culmination of this investigation conducted by the initial investigating trooper. 

CED assist only; disposition to be determined by Easton Barrack personnel.
